intro: Gonolobus gonocarpos, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its botanical features include a distinctive root system and the presence of alkaloids, which contribute to its medicinal uses. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
